    "appell s hypergeometric system @xmath1 is generated by differential equations ( [ eq : de ] ) annihilating appell s hypergeometric series @xmath0 of @xmath2 defined by ( [ eq : f4 ] ) , where @xmath3 and @xmath4 are parameters .",
    "it is a holonomic system of rank @xmath5 with singular locus @xmath6 where @xmath7 is the line at infinity in the projective plane @xmath8 .    in this paper",
    ", we study a pfaffian of the system @xmath1 by a twisted cohomology group @xmath9 associated to integrals ( [ eq : int - rep ] ) representing solutions to this system .",
    "we regard the pfaffian of @xmath1 as a connection @xmath10 of a vector bundle over @xmath11 with fiber @xmath9 over @xmath12 .",
    "we find a frame of this vector bundle and represent the connection as @xmath13 in theorem [ th : pfaff ] in terms of @xmath14-matrices @xmath15 and @xmath16 .",
    "the connection matrix satisfies the integrability condition @xmath17 and has no apparent singularity , but @xmath18 and @xmath19 are complicated and @xmath20 . to make the connection matrix simple",
    ", we consider a double cover @xmath21 of @xmath22 defined by a map @xmath23 it induces the pull - back bundle and the pull - back connection @xmath24 . by changing a frame of the pull - back bundle",
    ", we express the pull - back connection @xmath24 by @xmath25 in terms of logarithmic @xmath26-forms of the variables @xmath27 and @xmath28 in theorem [ th : conn - hat ] .",
    "in particular , we have @xmath29 .",
    "it is studied in @xcite that the pull - back of @xmath0 under a similar map satisfies a pfaffian equation equivalent to ours .",
    "there is the intersection pairing @xmath30 between @xmath9 and @xmath31 , which is defined by the dual derivative @xmath32 of @xmath33 .",
    "we have the dual vector bundle over @xmath22 and the dual connection @xmath34 satisfying @xmath35 where @xmath36 and @xmath37 are a section of the vector bundle and that of its dual , respectively , and @xmath38 is the exterior derivative with respect to @xmath39 and @xmath40 .",
    "we can not find a frame of @xmath9 satisfying @xmath41 for any @xmath42 , where @xmath43 and @xmath44 is the image of @xmath45 under the natural map from @xmath9 to @xmath46 .",
    "the intersection pairing is defined between the pull - back bundles , and the frame of the pull - back bundle used in theorem [ th : conn - hat ] satisfies the relations ( [ eq : flat ] ) for any @xmath42 .",
    "the existence of the frame enables us to represent the pull - back connection @xmath24 by the intersection form @xmath30 in theorem [ th : exp - conn - int ] .",
    "we remark that this expression is not given in terms of matrices .",
    "the monodromy representation of @xmath1 is initially given in @xcite by a twisted homology group associated to integrals ( [ eq : int - rep ] ) , and reconsidered in @xcite by the intersection pairing .",
    "in @xcite , we characterize the circuit transform of a loop turning around each component of @xmath47 by the intersection form and a subspace of vanishing cycles as @xmath48 approaches the component . in lemma [ lem : roots - exp ] , we characterize the coefficient matrix of the logarithmic @xmath26-form corresponding to a component of @xmath49 in @xmath25 by the intersection form and a subspace of vanishing forms as @xmath48 approaches the component , where @xmath49 is the preimage of @xmath47 under the double cover .",
    "appell s hypergeometric system @xmath1 is generalized to lauricella s hypergeometric system @xmath50 of rank @xmath51 with @xmath52 variables . for this system ,",
    "we have twisted ( co)homology groups associated to integrals representing solutions .",
    "the monodromy representation of @xmath50 is expressed in terms of intersection form between twisted homology groups in @xcite .",
    "however , we have not seen that the system @xmath50 admits a pfaffian system with a simple expression of the pull - back connection under some covering map .",
    "we think that it is important to find a covering map and a frame of its pull - back bundle satisfying the relations ( [ eq : flat ] ) for any @xmath53 .    for studies of pfaffians of lauricella s hypergeometric systems @xmath54 and @xmath55 of @xmath52-variables , it is easy to find such frames without considering covering maps .",
    "their pfaffians are expressed in terms of intersection forms between twisted cohomology groups associated to integrals representing solutions , refer to @xcite and @xcite .",
    "in @xcite , appell s hypergeometric series @xmath0 of variables @xmath57 with parameters @xmath58 , @xmath59 , @xmath4 is defined by @xmath60 where @xmath61 and @xmath62 .",
    "this series converges in the domain @xmath63 and satisfies differential equations @xmath64f(x)=0 , \\\\",

    "k. matsumoto , monodromy and pfaffian of lauricella s @xmath343 in terms of the intersection forms of twisted ( co)homology groups , kyushu j. math .",

    ", pfaffian of lauricella s hypergeometric system @xmath344 , preprint 2015 , arxiv:1502.00334 ."

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we study a pfaffian of the system of differential equations annihilating appell s hypergeometric series @xmath0 by twisted cohomology groups associated with integrals representing solutions to this system . </S>",
    "<S> we simplify its connection matrix by the pull - back under a double cover of the complement of the singular locus . </S>",
    "<S> we express the simplified connection matrix in terms of the intersection form of the twisted cohomology groups . </S>"
  ]
}
